--DEMO DE ROW LEVEL SECURITY

--To see how it works first we will create a test table and insert some sample values.

Create table dbo.Orders
(
Supplier_Code int,
[Supplier_name] varchar(10),
[Orderdate] datetime,
[OrderQuantity] int,
[ProcessedBy] Varchar(10)
)           
 
 -- Sample data
Insert into dbo.Orders values(101,'AXP Inc','2015-08-11 00:34:51:090',1789,'RENAN')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(102,'VFG Inc','2014-01-08 19:44:51:090',767,'MAIA')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(103,'ZAD Inc','2015-08-19 19:44:51:090',500,'IAGO')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(102,'VFG Inc','2014-08-19 19:44:51:090',1099,'IAGO')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(101,'AXP Inc','2014-08-04 19:44:51:090',654,'RENAN')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(103,'ZAD Inc','2015-08-10 19:44:51:090',498,'RENAN')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(102,'VFG Inc','2015-04-17 19:44:51:090',999,'RENAN')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(101,'AXP Inc','2015-08-21 19:44:51:090',543,'RENAN')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(103,'ZAD Inc','2015-08-06 19:44:51:090',876,'RENAN')
Insert into dbo.Orders values(102,'VFG Inc','2015-08-26 19:44:51:090',665,'RENAN')

--See the data
Select * from dbo.Orders

----------
--Based on our requirements, we will create a predicate function:

Create  Function fn_securitypredicateOrder (@processedby sysname)
returns table
with Schemabinding
as
return select 1 as [fn_securityPredicateOrder_result]
from 
dbo.orders
where @processedby = user_name()  -- it will be Filter applied while running the query

--In the next step we need to define a Security Policy that will use the predicate function created above:

Create security Policy fn_security
add Filter Predicate dbo.fn_securitypredicateOrder(processedby)
on dbo.Orders
WITH (STATE = ON); 

--CREATE THE USER AND PERMISSIONS

Create user RENAN without login;
go
Create user MAIA without login;
go
Create user IAGO without login;
go


Grant select on dbo.Orders to RENAN
go
Grant select on dbo.Orders to MAIA
go
Grant select on dbo.Orders to IAGO
go

--Se executar a query com os usuarios criados temos o resultado para aquele user especifico.

exec ('Select * from dbo.Orders') as user = 'MAIA'
exec ('Select * from dbo.Orders') as user = 'RENAN'
exec ('Select * from dbo.Orders') as user = 'IAGO'
